ilo: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of content and skills as mandated in the Humanities Victorian Curriculum.

Select content and apply teaching strategies associated with the Humanities and inclusive student-centred pedagogies when planning, structuring, sequencing, assessing and evaluating learning programs.
Enrich the teaching and learning of Humanities through the development differentiated of inquiry-based curriculum for all primary students.
Demonstrate the knowledge, skills, values and attitudes they intend to teach in the Humanities.
Use digital and design technologies and ICT resources when planning the Humanities curriculum.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Presentation: Expo presentation of excursion venue
Report: Written report and learning experience based on an excursion venue
Inquiry Unit Rationale: Inquiry unit rationale focusing on a generative question in the Humanities
Inquiry Unit: Inquiry-based unit of work (group assignment) focusing on the Humanities curriculum

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).
